page.title: 02Field Patterns and names
page.content:
The agricultural pattern in the block appears to be well established. An examination of field patterns in 1839 shows a great change, however. Most fields are now 'blocked'. For example, the triangular piece of land north of 426316 is now 2 fields but previously was 6. Each were named and known as Dovey Pool, Turnpike Field, William Wenlock's Low Leasow, Whitland, Croft, Our Own Cow Leasow and Brickiln Field.
One notable exception occurs in the area intersected by 320320. These were known as Milking Bank(in front of Colemere Woods Farm), Gorse Bank, Thistly, Wood Leasow, Woodwell Leasow, Godfrey, Pole Shutt, Nantigodale, Limekiln Leasow and Broomy Corner. Most of these names are now out of use but some are still recognised by farmers.
